macro.name: BOOST_ONCE_INIT
macro.purpose: The call_once function and once_flag type (statically initialized to BOOST_ONCE_INIT) can be used to run a routine exactly once. This can be used to initialize data in a thread-safe manner.
macro.description: The implementation-defined macro BOOST_ONCE_INIT is a constant value used to initialize once_flag instances to indicate that the logically associated routine has not been run yet. See call_once for more details.

typedef.name: once_flag
typedef.purpose: The call_once function and once_flag type (statically initialized to BOOST_ONCE_INIT) can be used to run a routine exactly once. This can be used to initialize data in a thread-safe manner.
typedef.description: The implementation-defined type once_flag is used as a flag to insure a routine is called only once. Instances of this type should be statically initialized to BOOST_ONCE_INIT. See call_once for more details.

function.name: call_once
function.purpose: The call_once function and once_flag type (statically initialized to BOOST_ONCE_INIT) can be used to run a routine exactly once. This can be used to initialize data in a thread-safe manner.
function.requires: The function func shall not throw exceptions.
function.effects: As if (in an atomic fashion): if (flag == BOOST_ONCE_INIT) func();
